meanings.definition: The act of cutting off or removing
meanings.sent1: The recisions of the damaged part were necessary for safety.
meanings.sent2: The recisions of the excess branches made the tree look neat.
meanings.sent3: He performed recisions on the paper snowflake, making it smaller and more intricate.
meanings.sent4: Her recisions of toxic relationships from her life left her feeling lighter.
meanings.sent5: The recisions of the tumor were precise and successful.

meanings.definition: The act of canceling or annulling
meanings.sent1: The recisions of the event disappointed many attendees.
meanings.sent2: The recisions of the contract were due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The recisions of the party left everyone puzzled and curious.
meanings.sent4: His recisions of the vacation plans dashed their hopes for a trip.
meanings.sent5: The recisions of the wedding caused chaos among the guests.

meanings.definition: The act of revoking or rescinding
meanings.sent1: The recisions of the law surprised the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The recisions of the decision were met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The recisions of the promise made him seem unreliable.
meanings.sent4: Her recisions of the invitation hurt the host's feelings.
meanings.sent5: The recisions of the order led to confusion among the staff.
